input_data.title: Mary Kills People
input_data.overview: Dr. Mary Harris, a single mother and emergency doctor by day, also moonlights as an underground angel of death - helping terminally ill patients who want to die and slip away on their own terms. So far Mary has managed to stay under the radar; but business is booming, and her double life is getting complicated. When her world starts to unravel, Mary realizes she's going to have to fight dirty if she's going to stay in the killing game.

response.analytical_summary: Mary Kills People is a dark and morally complex Canadian crime drama that explores themes of euthanasia, grief, and the lengths to which a woman will go to alleviate suffering. The series blends elements of medical drama, thriller, and crime procedural, creating a suspenseful and emotionally charged narrative. It examines the ethical dilemmas surrounding assisted suicide and the psychological toll on those involved, while maintaining a darkly comedic tone that underscores the absurdity of the situations. The series follows a seemingly ordinary doctor who secretly provides end-of-life services, navigating a dangerous double life and facing increasing scrutiny.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Dr. Mary Harris, a widowed single mother, operating as an underground provider of assisted suicide. She carefully selects patients who are terminally ill and desperate for a peaceful end, meticulously covering her tracks with the help of her partner, Des Barker. As her practice grows, Mary attracts the attention of Detective Gabriel Miller, who begins investigating a series of suspicious deaths. Simultaneously, a new patient, Julian, enters Mary’s life, bringing with him a complex and unsettling connection to her past. Julian’s presence complicates Mary’s operations and forces her to confront painful memories. The investigation intensifies, threatening to expose Mary’s secret and endangering her family. As the season progresses, Mary’s carefully constructed world begins to crumble, forcing her to make increasingly difficult choices and confront the consequences of her actions. The series culminates in a confrontation where Mary’s past and present collide, leaving her to fight for her freedom and protect those she cares about.
response.keyword_sentence: Mary Kills People is a darkly comic crime drama that explores the moral complexities of assisted suicide and the lengths a woman will go to alleviate suffering, set against a modern urban backdrop.
